thread.title: Pharrell Williams Joins Mob of Famous People Affiliated With NYU
thread.title_full: Pharrell Williams Joins Mob of Famous People Affiliated With NYU

title: Pharrell Williams Joins Mob of Famous People Affiliated With NYU
text:
Pharrell Williams Joins Mob of Famous People Affiliated With NYU By Danielle Tcholakian | October 20, 2015 4:20pm Twitter Facebook Email More 
Some happy news for New York University students and Greenwich Village denizens who like seeing famous people: Pharrell Williams is this year's artist-in-residence at the Tisch School of the Arts. 
“Pharrell is just the kind of artist and entrepreneur that many of our students aspire to become," said Allyson Green, dean of Tisch School of the Arts, in a statement. 
Williams will be the focus of a "career retrospective discussion" and Q&A event on Oct. 26, but the event is only open to school students, faculty and staff. NYU said future events are in the works. 
Williams is just one of many celebrities drawn to NYU. Here are a few others: Karlie Kloss A photo posted by @karliekloss on Sep 2, 2015 at 4:37pm PDT Instagram/@karliekloss 
Former Victoria's Secret angel Karlie Kloss was nervous on her first day of school this year, proving that celebrities really are just like us. (If we were taller, perfectly toned, and our hair looked like spun gold.) Tavi Gevinson Oct 1, 2015 at 3:48pm PDT Instagram/@tavitulle 
Power teen Tavi Gevinson supposedly started at NYU this year, but how she added school to her life of producing a magazine endorsed by Jane Pratt and Ira Glass, starring on Broadway , speaking to massive crowds like a tiny cult leader and hanging with her friends and taking selfies like a mostly average teen is mystifying. John Catsimatidis, Jr. John CATS Jr Graduating NYU Stern Business SchoolJohn Sexton Presents the Presidents Award to @johncatsjr pic.twitter.com/1GEHzAF5Ez — John Catsimatidis (@JCats2013) May 17, 2015 Twitter/@JCats2013 
The son of New York City's almost-mayor/grocery store mogul/ oil baron John Catsimatidis graduated from NYU just last year, and is now stumping for Jeb! as the chair of the New York Federation of College Republicans. Spike Lee Oct 20, 2015 at 8:52am PDT Instagram/@officialspikelee 
Film director Spike Lee is a professor at the Tisch School of the Arts . Maybe he and Pharrell can hang. Dakota Fanning Aug 1, 2015 at 11:12pm PDT Instagram/@officialdakotafanning
